summary: This bill, the M.H. Dutch Salmon Greater Gila Wild and Scenic River Act, amends the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to designate segments of the Gila River system in New Mexico as components of the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System. It defines these segments, classifies them as wild, scenic, or recreational rivers, and outlines management plans.  The bill also transfers administrative jurisdiction of approximately 440 acres of land from the Secretary of Agriculture to the Secretary of the Interior, modifying the boundaries of the Gila Cliff Dwellings National Monument and Gila National Forest.
